comments: Making Online Content Accessible for All is designed to equip course designers, educators, and learning and development specialists with practical, actionable strategies for creating accessible digital content. The course emphasizes the intersection of accessibility, usability, and inclusive design, aligning with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), and Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles. Delivered through D2L, this course offers practical insights beyond compliance, helping participants build inclusive learning environments that support diverse learners.
description: Making Online Content Accessible for All is an in-depth 6-week course designed to equip educators, instructional designers, and consultants with the skills to create and evaluate accessible digital content. Focusing on the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.2) and neurodivergent design principles.
length: 28-30 hours (4-5 hours a week for 6 weeks).
title: Making Online Content Accessible For All
topics: Inclusive online course design, accessible multimedia and documents.
